Text: Every county in IL13 is important. I was glad to spend the afternoon in Monticello in Piatt County with Piatt Dems’ Chairwoman Sheila Maloney and with some local supporters. https://t.co/QaSHd2M52S

Always great to be in Decatur. Thanks to Melverta Wilkins for showing me the important job training work you do at your business, Sister Girls and Friends, Inc. Macon County is the #1 county for manufacturing in IL – we need to invest in job training union apprenticeship programs https://t.co/V07M6BSWTY

Small towns like Virden in Macoupin County are the backbone of IL13. I appreciate Mr. and Mrs. Alexander showing me around their store, Books on the Block, and around downtown this morning. https://t.co/JUvgIFbOWR
Thank you @tedlieu, it was great to be with you today on Primary Election Day!  Thank you for stopping thru IL13! https://t.co/ZfYcSJoW1z

Awesome morning with @RepKatieStuart at 222 Bakery in Edwardsville meeting voters. People are ready for a rep that’s focused on fighting inflation, tackling rising costs, and helping people keep more of what they earn. Thanks to @tedlieu for joining us! https://t.co/B4qFU6j54g

Great start to the day meeting with labor leaders at The Abbey in Belleville in St. Clair County this morning. We’re going to flip this seat union blue this November with our working family agenda. https://t.co/b3fcGM9Zwm

It’s finally election day! I’ll be travelling across all 7 counties in IL13 meeting with voters and community leaders. Be sure to follow along on all of our social media pages and make sure you get out and vote!
I'm looking forward to joining friends at our election night watch party tomorrow! Please be sure to stop by if you're in Springfield! https://t.co/Sas8qonVBO

The SCOTUS decision reverses decades of reproductive freedom for women across the country. My heart goes out to all the women that have fought to keep reproductive healthcare a decision between a woman and her doctor. In Congress, I will fight for women’s healthcare rights. https://t.co/1rFoNqTJ74

Election day is a week from today! We need all hands on deck to make sure we turn our vote out. If you haven’t already, please sign up for a volunteer shift with us this weekend! 

 https://t.co/ulY5paFfgA
I'm looking forward to being with Sam Madonia on 1450 / 92.3 FM this morning to talk about our race and the issues I'm hearing about on the campaign. Be sure to tune in!

I ended Juneteenth weekend at the
first-annual Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc. Juneteenth Scholarship Gala in Springfield. Happy Juneteenth! https://t.co/XB0QiZqXgC
Happy Juneteenth! Today marks 157 years since the final group of enslaved people in Texas were freed. I’m looking forward to spending today remembering this important day. https://t.co/G02JWdnlS4

Happy Father’s Day to all the Dads+Father figures today. I'm blessed with an amazing Dad who provides gardening tips, delicious home cooked meals, endless ball throws for grandpup Lulu and all the unconditional love and support a daughter could ever hope for. Happy Father’s Day! https://t.co/5q0a2TsHvV

I was glad to be at the first annual Tri-Cities Juneteenth Celebration in Venice today. Great to see Venice Mayor Tyrone Echols, Brooklyn Mayor Vera Glasper Banks, Madison Mayor John Hamm and many other leaders. https://t.co/wKvMpoI0yb

We had a great stop at the Alton Juneteenth Celebration today! It was great to see Alton Mayor David Goins, Madison County Circuit Judge Candidate Ebony Huddleston, and IL-111 candidate Joe Silkwood. https://t.co/o9IxpfNDQt
Be sure to stop by our table at the Juneteenth Emancipation Day Celebration at Douglass Park if you are in Champaign today! https://t.co/FFonw90Kpj
We began Juneteenth celebration today at the East St. Louis Juneteenth Celebration. Looking forward to seeing everyone across the district today! https://t.co/sfjkViqnwz

I was honored to speak at the @NALC_National convention today. Letter carriers are an underappreciated and critical part of our country running on time. As a member of Congress, I’ll always support them and the important work they do. https://t.co/VThOlVk6sd

Always great to be in Belleville! I had an awesome evening at the St. Clair County Dems annual steak fry last night. St. Clair County is ready to flip #IL13 blue this November! https://t.co/CQEqCTwC7s

Congratulations @senatorcrowe on your new role and thank you for your service to working families.  I always appreciated the opportunity to work with you.  Wishing you all the best! https://t.co/5hGzc2lsch

This is why we need to raise the federal minimum wage to $15 right now. It’s impossible to pay rent on the minimum wage, let alone support a family. Working people need relief.

https://t.co/alY7aGk6z3
Thank you @iftaft, I will always be a champion for public education and your members.  I appreciate your support! https://t.co/Y1R0Tqr96h

Special shout out to Blackbird Bakery and Cafe and @emilypaul84 for hosting our event last night.  The cafe is a special treasure in Staunton.  The cupcakes were my favorite!  #Macoupin https://t.co/6GtPLd5ecb

Thank you so much @AndyManar and @MacoupinBlue for a special event tonight at Blackbird Bakery & Cafe!  I really enjoyed meeting with so many great Democrats.  Let’s #FlipIL13! https://t.co/xbcaxjY1xU
Looking forward to it!  See @AndyManar and @MacoupinBlue tonight! https://t.co/CzvTq9Y97G

Illinois is the #1 producer of soybean in the United States. We need to be investing in alternative fuel sources, especially biofuels like soybean oils. 

https://t.co/A3ooyjuYWA
Thank you @ILDCCA for your support!  I’m excited to work with you to #Flipthe13th and help elect Democrats up and down the ballot! https://t.co/iWKMtmnxPw
Always great to be in Piatt County. Thank you to the Piatt Dems for having me at your fundraiser in Monticello tonight and thank you for your work and activism. https://t.co/Roo9lAiEC9

I was glad to be with the Uniting Pride of Champaign County at their Pride Party today! I’ll always support the LGBTQ+ community and will fight to pass the Equality Act in Congress. https://t.co/hMcWT7JBHz
I had a great morning at Pilgrim Missionary Baptist Church in Champaign this morning. Thank you to Pastor Rickey E. Parks and the entire congregation for having me! https://t.co/c8gIV35c61
I had a great time at the Alton Branch NAACP Freedom Fund Banquet tonight. Thank you for having me! https://t.co/OYphz22rJD

I was glad to attend the March for Our Lives rally in Springfield today. We need action on commonsense ideas like universal background checks and red flag laws now - and the majority of Americans agree. https://t.co/gWjExVyIxK

We need to bring the cost of gas down now. One of the ways we can do it is by permitting the year-round sale of E-15. This would empower Illinois farmers and provide immediate relief at the pump.

https://t.co/Fbob0ZpoBw

Have you gotten your #NikkiforCongress yard sign yet? You can request them at the link below and we even deliver them! Be sure to get yours before the June 28th primary. 

https://t.co/E4HV500veM

Thanks to everyone that came out to the Faith Coalition for the Common Good’s candidate forum in Springfield on Tuesday! It’s important we’re addressing issues like inflation, rising costs, and prescription drug prices.

https://t.co/a2f1stI1Wv

I had a great time at the Edwardsville Democratic Committee’s fundraiser last night! We need to build our party from the ground up and support the people on the ground doing the work. https://t.co/uhQURRUnq2

I was thrilled to speak at the Statewide Building and Construction Trades Council meeting today in Springfield. In Congress, I’ll sponsor the PRO act, fight to protect PLAs, and always be on the side of working people. https://t.co/ZRB0eAcQpk

Please consider giving below to help us keep it on the air!

https://t.co/edLSdPTcHd

I’m so thankful to everyone that’s believed in my campaign and helped us get to this point. Check out our first TV ad of the cycle 👇.

https://t.co/XiMobGUBKg
Thank you to everyone that came out to our Champaign canvass launch and hit the doors with us over the weekend! https://t.co/vC1QR8VAjX
Thank you to the Edwardsville NAACP for having me at your 57th annual Freedom Fund Awards banquet yesterday! https://t.co/YBOvibLVzN

It was great to be in East St. Louis kicking off our canvas with many of our volunteers. When I’m elected to Congress, I’ll always show up and fight for every community in St. Clair County that hasn’t had real representation from Republicans in Congress over the last 10 years. https://t.co/lgf9G2wFHo

I’m grateful to everyone that came out this morning and especially @DickDurbin to cast their ballot with me. Voting early is convenient and easy - be sure to vote early or make a plan to cast your ballot on election day! https://t.co/GKXD8vQUNk

Today is National Gun Violence Awareness Day. We have to make progress on ideas that the overwhelming majority of Americans support, like universal background checks and red flag laws. We can’t accept continued non-action on this issue. https://t.co/vGjc1dxBxw

Thanks to everyone who participated in this week's “Women with Nikki” postcard parties! We’re working hard to flip IL-13 from Red to Blue and I’m incredibly grateful to have such amazing women by my side. Interested in hosting your own party? Visit: https://t.co/1fpaS18Tps https://t.co/D9IFbrBUmN

I was proud to help kick start Connect Illinois and Chair the Broadband Advisory Council. Connect Illinois will help connect thousands of Illinois residents to low-cost, high-speed internet. Let’s continue to support programs like these!

https://t.co/LrbjTtj8yt

We need leaders that will bring people together to get things done, not try and divide us. I’ve spent my career standing up for working families. In Congress, I’ll work with anyone to do the same thing. 

https://t.co/iZI6AaW15l

Today is the first day of LGBTQ Pride Month! I’m looking forward to celebrating the LGBTQ+ community over the next month. We need to stand up against hate and make sure the LGBTQ+ community is protected by making the Equality Act law.

When @JBPritzker ran for Governor, he wanted to put Springfield back on the side of working families. I’m glad to join him in that fight, am thankful for his support, and look forward to getting to work. https://t.co/OxhIkBvVmc

Internet isn’t a luxury - it’s a necessity to access the 21st-century economy. In Congress, I’ll support programs like this that provide low-cost, high-speed internet access to families across #IL13.

https://t.co/txKjgdkCMs

In Congress, I’ll always be committed to fighting for working families. Learn more about my campaign by checking out the link below! 

https://t.co/lOau6OTDj3
I think of these two WWII servicemen everyday.  Grandpa Budzinski and Grandpa Weber, who both lived by example.  Happy Memorial Day.  ♥️♥️ https://t.co/ALY6Xd6mfg

This #MemorialDay and every day we are grateful to each American and their families that made the ultimate sacrifice for our country. We will always be indebted to them - today we remember and honor the sacrifice of all that have served. https://t.co/QiH1Hppvsk
Thanks to everyone that came out to knock doors in Champaign this morning! It was a beautiful day to hit the doors and talk to voters. https://t.co/1kb57QxPbN

2022 has been a wave of union organizing so far. I support these efforts and will always fight to protect a worker’s right to organize. 

https://t.co/nFEYtd7rnS

Mother Jones was an inspiration and a leader of the labor movement. I’m glad to see she will be continually recognized at the Mt Olive International Mother Jones Festival in Macoupin County! 

https://t.co/pGMO6zr7tP
We need more love in this world. My heart breaks for the families of the innocent children and their teacher that were victims of this senseless and horrific act in Texas. We must stop the violence.

We need relief at the pump now. Securing year-round sales of E-15 will drastically bring down the price of gas and support American farmers. Thank you for your bipartisan leadership on this issue, @CheriBustos!

https://t.co/PH6Xonzrec

We need immediate action to address the shortage of baby formula. I'm glad that @TammyDuckworth and @DickDurbin are leading the charge on this issue in the Senate.

https://t.co/xw634IO2YT

Today is the first day you can vote early and turn in your ballot for the June 28th primary! Be sure to check with your local election officials for early voting hours and locations.

It's almost time to begin voting! Please join us virtually or at our Springfield office this Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. to reach out to voters across IL13 and make sure they know about our campaign.

https://t.co/XKNcNBCzni

Thanks to everyone that came to our office opening in Springfield today! We’re focused on getting on the doors and meeting people where they are - coming to a door near you soon. https://t.co/tqc3EPgTgk

I’m so grateful for all the women that attended our “Women With Nikki” summit this morning. I would be the first woman to ever represent IL13 in Congress. Now more than ever, we need to elect more pro-choice women to federal leadership. I’m so grateful for all of your support! https://t.co/ZLpOhN8tej

Please be sure to support the Stamp Out Hunger food drive by leaving non-perishable food items outside your mailbox on Saturday! The @NALC_National will collect them and take them to the Central Illinois Foodbank. 

https://t.co/fHxZE3UJPb

RT @DickDurbin: The decision by Senate Republicans to AGAIN stand in the way of fundamental reproductive freedoms is outrageous.

But this…

I got the chance to tour Midwest Mission Distribution Center this afternoon, and I’m truly inspired by the work they do for our community. I look forward to coming back soon and supporting the work you do for Sangamon County. https://t.co/9eFqLjtT9q

I was glad to spend the morning touring Alton Memorial Hospital in Madison County.

There’s been a constant strain on our local hospitals since COVID began - we need strong federal partners that will work with local hospitals to get them the support and resources they need. https://t.co/Gjz7zh4hek

I am thankful to have the Southwestern Illinois Central Labor Council's support! I'm proud to be a union Democrat and will always stand with working people.

https://t.co/hkIJ0K7mD1

I enjoyed meeting workers at ADM in Decatur this morning to talk about our campaign. ADM is a critical employer in our region. We talked about their new Protein Innovation Center and other important work they are doing. https://t.co/jEVxpmEYo8

National experts just called our race House Democrats’ “single best target” to win a seat and help hold the house. We can win this race, but we need the resources to do it. Please chip in $5, $10, or whatever you can below! 

https://t.co/6vKmlfxkuZ

https://t.co/edLSdPBBiD

Happy Mother's Day to all moms out there and especially to my mom, Cheryl Budzinski. My mom taught me the importance of being involved in the community, politically informed, and engaged and the power of giving back. Love you, Mom! https://t.co/0KKx4xiedH
@monicapatel917 @tayloremrey Beautiful inside and out!

The perfect should never be the enemy of the good. I’ll always work to bring people together - Democrats and Republicans - to get things done for working families. That’s what I did in my career, and it’s what I’ll do in Congress. 

https://t.co/Gz2vj07QCE
Thank you @AndyManar!  I’m looking forward to meeting up at Blackbird Bakery in Staunton! https://t.co/EFhvueoOi2

Read my statement on the likely SCOTUS decision here. We'll fight every day to win this seat and protect reproductive health.

https://t.co/LLN0FuyiqZ

I am OUTRAGED for all women in this country.  The Supreme Court is taking away a woman’s ability to make her own decision about her own body.  This horrifying opinion overturns decades of legal precedent supporting the rights of women in this country. https://t.co/OWPhwdDPWa

Decatur is a diverse and inspiring community that I would be proud to represent in Congress.  I’ll be a partner to ADM and support increased manufacturing and job opportunities for Decatur’s working families.

https://t.co/PIIcSDqTLW

I was honored to speak at the Decatur Trades and Labor Assembly Workers Memorial Ceremony yesterday. We celebrated the creation of worker safety standards and commemorated all who have lost their lives on the job. https://t.co/DmZZMatPw3

I enjoyed checking in with @byers_brian yesterday on 1340 AM / 103.3 FM WSOY on our race. Check out our conversation at the link below!

https://t.co/g0Irzg798w
It was an honor to be with so many champions for working families to commemorate Workers Memorial Day in Decatur. https://t.co/0Vb6a6eNHo

Today is Workers Memorial Day, where we remember every worker that’s lost their lives on the job and to recommit ourselves to safety. Working for meatpackers, I’ve seen firsthand the importance of a union. In Congress, I’ll fight every day for worker safety. https://t.co/kZdkqjLvoz

Congrats to the CU Mass Transit District for being 1/10 transit agencies recognized for working to reduce their environmental footprint! The transit district’s two new zero-emission buses are the future of mass transit.

https://t.co/RL6gl46geN

I was honored to be with Pastor William DeShone Rosser in fellowship at Pleasant Grove Baptist Church in Springfield this morning. The service was incredible and I had great time meeting members of the congregation after the service. https://t.co/NYPbSSvaaI

There is no one more qualified for this position and dedicated to the people of Southern Illinois than @senatorcrowe. You will be dearly missed in the state senate, but this is great news for the people of the Southern District of IL. Congratulations! https://t.co/pBsHHFmS6I

IUOE Local 965 is an incredible asset to Springfield and our entire region. I was fortunate to tour their training school today and hear about the progress they are making with their apprenticeship program. We need to increase access to training programs like this. https://t.co/siZgq0cxUp
Happy Earth Day! In Congress, I’ll be committed to protecting the planet for future generations. https://t.co/actRgDQK2w

I had a great time at the Women’s Power Lunch Against Cancer today in Springfield! This awesome event supports cancer research at the Simmons Cancer Institute at SIU and brings together great leaders in Sangamon County. https://t.co/hEZf3LsQGv
I’m thrilled to have the support of @StopBigMoney. I look forward to working with ECU and flipping IL13 blue this November. https://t.co/4qd7G8xgh4

I had a great lunch with the Community Bankers Association of Illinois yesterday meeting tons of bankers and leaders in IL13. I enjoyed hearing about how federal partners need to work with local leaders to support the work you do. https://t.co/e8L9H9CxXW

I'm proud to be a union Democrat. I spent a decade working in the labor movement for meatpackers, grocery store workers, and fire fighters. In Congress, I'll always stand with working people. I'm proud to stand with my union brother @jdixon2600. 

https://t.co/HrivxVxJDY

We need to start making things in America again.

I helped set up the Made in America office which prioritizes American manufacturing. I commend the President for prioritizing American steel. This will help manufacturers like U.S. Steel in Granite City.

https://t.co/B9stDqujma

I enjoyed addressing the @IBEW State Council at their annual conference in Springfield this morning. In Congress, I’ll fight side by side with working people. We need to make it easier to join a union, enforce PLAs and prevailing wages, and pass the PRO Act. #NikkiforCongress https://t.co/H5gIsLGLSr

There’s no question that paid leave is crucial for young families. This is common sense. We need to take steps on the federal level toward paid parental leave and this is something that I would support as a member of Congress. 

https://t.co/0KtVL5CiiM
I'm wishing everyone a happy and restful Easter! I hope you are able to spend the day relaxing, with your family, and celebrating. https://t.co/ZbuOrLdxWq
